result.execSummary:
The defendant Dametri G. Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $7778.51 plus surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.  CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence including Racine County case 14CF790.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Hearing on letter from DOC regarding sentence credit.  Attorney Binger states that the DE was serving his sentence in Racine County case 14CF790 since May 2016 and since the Court's sentence in this case was consecutive to any other sentence, he wouldn't be eligible for any sentence credit over 14 days as indicated in the sentencing on revocation hearing on 11/4/16.  The Court notes that the JOC did not indicate that the sentence in this case was consecutive to any other sentence.  The Court orders that the JOC be amended to reflect that the sentence in this case is consecutive to any other sentence including Racine County case 14CF790.  Attorney Young to submit a letter within 14 days to this court if she feels an error was made.
Hearing on December 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
With Attorney Young and the District Attorney's Office; hearing scheduled for 12/22/16 @ 8:30; notice will be sent
Court has reviewed letter from DOC and at the SAR, the DA recommended 14 days CFTS.  The DE's attorney was to submit a letter within 14 days.  The Sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.
Per Judge Kerkman, schedule a hearing regarding the letter from DOC; hearing scheduled for 12/22/16 @ 8:30 with Atty Young and ADA Braun
from DOC regarding sentence credit
Conditions of Extended Supervision imposed by the Judge

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP; 1 year initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/ conditions, consecutive to any other sentence; 14 days credit for time served.  Atty Young may provide a letter to the court within 14 days if she feels the DE has more sentence credit.  The DE is eligible for CIP/SAP.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk: PT
Atty Young states she hasn't had the opportunity to meet with the DE as she didn't realize he was at RCI so she is requesting a new date; no objection by the State.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 11:15 am.
